content:
As an AI language model, I do not have access to specific information on the Third Division or any other departments. However, I can provide a general answer based on how collaborations can work successfully.

Successful collaboration between departments is critical to achieving organizational objectives. The following are some examples of what can contribute to successful collaborations:

1. Common Goals: Both departments must have a clear understanding of the goal(s) they are working towards. When goals are aligned, it is easier to work together to achieve them.

2. Effective Communication: Good communication is the key to any successful collaboration. Departments must communicate frequently and effectively to ensure that everyone is working towards the same objectives.

3. Mutual Trust and Respect: Collaboration is more effective when there is mutual trust and respect between departments. It allows each department to have the confidence that the other will do their part to achieve common goals.

4. Clear Roles and Responsibilities: The roles and responsibilities of each department must be clearly defined to avoid confusion and prevent any overlap in activities.

5. Openness to New Ideas: An open-minded approach brings agility, innovation, and flexibility to collaboration. Departments should be willing to explore new ideas and be willing to try new methods to achieve their goals.

6. Effective Change Management: Any collaboration process may go through iterations before arriving at a final outcome. Effective change management can reduce friction and facilitate a smoother collaboration process.

These factors, and others like them, can make collaboration between departments successful.
